title: torch.dot for tensors of dimension > 1
body_html:
In [16]: torch.dot?
Docstring:
dot(tensor1, tensor2) -> float

Computes the dot product (inner product) of two tensors.

.. note:: This function does not :ref:`broadcast <broadcasting-semantics>`.

Example::

    >>> torch.dot(torch.Tensor([2, 3]), torch.Tensor([2, 1]))
    7.0
In [17]: torch.dot(torch.ones(5,5), torch.ones(5,5))
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                          Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-17-2aa8fb369b00> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.dot(torch.ones(5,5), torch.ones(5,5))

RuntimeError: Expected argument self to have 1 dimension(s), but has 2 at /pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp:23086

In [11]: torch.__version__
Out[11]: '0.2.0_1'

This is incosistent with lua torch:

th> a = torch.rand(5,5)
                                                                      [0.0002s]	
th> torch.dot(a, a)
5.7623031292751

body:
```
In [16]: torch.dot?
Docstring:
dot(tensor1, tensor2) -> float

Computes the dot product (inner product) of two tensors.

.. note:: This function does not :ref:`broadcast <broadcasting-semantics>`.

Example::

    >>> torch.dot(torch.Tensor([2, 3]), torch.Tensor([2, 1]))
    7.0
In [17]: torch.dot(torch.ones(5,5), torch.ones(5,5))
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                          Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-17-2aa8fb369b00> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.dot(torch.ones(5,5), torch.ones(5,5))

RuntimeError: Expected argument self to have 1 dimension(s), but has 2 at /pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp:23086

In [11]: torch.__version__
Out[11]: '0.2.0_1'
```

This is incosistent with lua torch:

```
th> a = torch.rand(5,5)
                                                                      [0.0002s]	
th> torch.dot(a, a)
5.7623031292751	
```
